required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Structured Physical Training With and Without Cognitive Support for Adults With ADHD
clinical_study.official_title: Support in Activity, Movement and exercise-for Adults With ADHD. A Randomized Controlled Trial Intervention Study With 12 Weeks of Physical Training With and Without Cognitive Support.

brief_summary.textblock:
Studies in children and adolescents with Attention-Deficit-Hyperactivity-Disorder (ADHD) have shown that physical exercise can improve the core symptoms of ADHD; inattention and hyperactivity. For adults, the evidence is deficient and there is a great need to investigate whether adults have the same effect on ADHD symptoms of physical exercise, as children and young people have. Adults with ADHD often have a sedentary lifestyle and suffer from obesity and have sleep problems. In a normal population, these problems have been shown to be affectable with physical exercise. START (Support in Activity, Movement and Exercise) is a randomized controlled intervention study where physical exercise is given for 12 weeks, with or without cognitive support. The effect is measured with rating scales as well as cognitive and physical tests. The purpose is to investigate whether START works as a treatment for ADHD in terms of ADHD symptoms and disability, and what impact the intervention has on mental health, physical condition and activity level, body awareness and everyday functioning.
Outcome measures are registered within 3 weeks before and after the end of treatment, after 6 months and 12 months. The randomization takes place in three groups; physical exercise (i), physical exercise and extra cognitive support (ii), and control group on waiting list (iii).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
primary_outcome.description: Assess total improvement on a Richter scale. Range 1-7, Higher scores mean worse outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Adult ADHD Self-Report Scale (ASRS-v.1.1)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
primary_outcome.description: Range 0-72, higher scores mean worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Cardio Respiratory Fitness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in millilitre per kilogram per minute with the Ekblom-Bak test, a submaximal exercise test. Higher value means better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Grip Strength
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in kilogram with JAMAR hand dynamometer. Higher value means better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Balance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with Flamingo test. The test person is standing on the preferred leg on a low balance profile for 60 seconds. The number of times that the test person puts his/her foot to the ground is counted. Lower value means better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Body Mass Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Weight and height will be measured in kilograms and centimeters, and combined to report BMI in kg/m^2. Lower value means better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Abdominal Circumference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with a measuring tape in centimeters. Lower value means better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Body Awareness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Body Awareness Scale - movement quality and experience (BAS MQ-E). Higher value means better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Both systolic and diastolic blood pressure will be measured in mm Hg with a blood pressure monitor on the arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Satisfaction with Daily Occupations-Occupational Balance (SDO-OB) activity score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Range 0-17, higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Satisfaction with daily occupations and occupational balance (SDO-OB) satisfaction score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Global satisfaction score, range 1-5, lower scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Canadian Occupational Performance Measure (COPM) perfomance score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Range 5-50, higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Canadian Occupational Performance Measure (COPM) satisfaction score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Range 5-50, higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Adult ADHD Quality of Life Measure (AAQoL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Range 29-145, higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Self Efficacy Scale (GSE-10)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Range 0-40, higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Assessment of Time Management Skills-Swedish (ATMS-S) Time management subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: 11 items, reported as 0-100 ATMS units, higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Assessment of Time Management Skills-Swedish (ATMS-S), Organization and planning sub scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: 11 items, reported as 0-100 ATMS units, higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Assessment of Time Management Skills-Swedish (ATMS-S), Regulation of emotions sub scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: 5 items, reported as 0-100 ATMS units, higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in EuroQuality of Life - 5 dimensions - 5 levels (EQ-5D-5L): item scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: 5 items scored 1-5

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in EuroQuality of Life - 5 dimensions - 5 levels (EQ-5D-5L): global score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: One visual-analogue-scale answer (range 0-100), higher scores are better

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Continuous Performance Test (AX-CPT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Measures cognitive flexibility. Will be done in conjunction with functional Magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in GO/NoGO
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Measures impulse control. Will be done in conjunction with functional Magnetic resonance Imaging (fMRI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes Affective Picture series (IAPS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Measures emotion regulation. Will be done in conjunction with functional Magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood hemoglobin levels (Hb)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Used to assess general health and to screen for conditions that affect red blood cells. Is measured in g/L. Low and high balus indicate worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood platelet count (PC/TBK)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Used to assess general health and screen for conditions that affect blood platelets. Is measued in10*9/L. Low and high values indicate worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood leukocyte count (WBC / LPK)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Used to Asses general health and screen for changes in white blood count. Is measured in 10*6/L. Low and high values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in plasma alanine transaminase levels (ALT /ALAT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Part of the hepatic panel used to assess general health related to liver disease. Is measured in microkat/L. High values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in plasma aspartate aminotransferase levels (AST /ASAT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Part of hepatic panel used to assess general health related to liver disease. Is measured in microkat/L. High values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in plasma thyroid-stimulating hormone levels (TSH)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Part of general health screening to assess the function of the thyroid hormone. Is measured in mIE/L. Low and high values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in plasma creatinine levels (Krea)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Part of a general health screening to assess the function of the kidneys. Is measured in micromol/L. High values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in serum sodium leves (s-Na)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Part of a general health screening to assess electrolyte balance. Is measured in mmol/L. Low and high values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in serum potassium levels (s-K)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Part of a general health screening to assess electrolyte balance. Is measured in mmol/L. Low and high values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood phosphatidylethanol levels (PeTH)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: A test to assess alcohol overconsumption. Is measured in micromol/L. High values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in high-sensitivity plasma C-reactive protein levels (CRP-high sensitive).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses general levels of inflammation in the body. Is measured in mg/L. High values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood interleukin- 6 levels (IL-6)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: A marker of immune system activation. Is measured in ng/L. High values indicate worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood hemoglobin A1c levels (HbA1c)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses the level of sugar attached to hemoglobin and indicates the level of blood sugar of the past 2-3 months. Is measured in mmol/mol. High values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in total plasma cholesterol levels (cholesterol)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses cardiovascular disease risk. Is measured in mmol/L. High values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in HDL plasma cholesterol levels (HDL-cholesterol)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses cardiovascular disease risk. Is measured in mmol/L. High values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in LSL plasma cholesterol levels (LDL-cholesterol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses cardiovascular disease risk. Is measured in mmol/L. High values indicate worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in plasma triglyceride levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses cardiovascular disease risks. Is measured in mmol/L. High values indicate worse outcome

other_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, post-intervention (12 weeks) and 3, 6 and 12 months after intervention start

arm_group.description: Medium-high-intensity physical training 3 times a week, 60 min / time for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Physical training combined with cognitive support
arm_group.description: Medium-high-intensity physical training 3 times a week, 60 min / time for 12 weeks. The cognitive support consists of person centred individual occupational therapy.
The control group receive no intervention.

intervention.description: Medium-high-intensity physical training 3 times a week, 60 min / time for 12 weeks, consisting of fitness, strength and mobility exercises with a target level of 60-90% of maximum heart rate. Two sessions per week take place in a group led by a physiotherapist and once a week the training consists of self-chosen training individually or in group.

intervention.intervention_name: Physical training combined with cognitive support.
intervention.description: Medium-high-intensity physical training 3 times a week, 60 min / time for 12 weeks, consisting of fitness, strength and mobility exercises with a target level of 60-90% of maximum heart rate. Two sessions per week take place in a group led by a physiotherapist and once a week the training consists of self-chosen training individually or in group. The cognitive support consists of person centred individual occupational therapy with focus on daily time management skills and planning and organisation in daily life, i.e. make time for physical exercise. The number of session during the intervention period depend on the participants needs and is estimated to 4-6 sessions.
intervention.arm_group_label: Physical training combined with cognitive support

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with ADHD.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ongoing depression with points on MADRS-S over 21
- Suicidality
- Bipolar disorder
- Psychosis
- Ongoing addiction
- Reported threatening behavior.
- Severe autism that makes group participation impossible
- Inability to read and understand the Swedish language

overall_official.affiliation: Örebro University and Regional Örebro County

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared with researchers within the research group only.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will become available from study start to the end of the study
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: To get access the person have to be involved in all parts of the study. Access is decided by PI. Access to data is password protected in accordance with the European General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
